page.title: 08LIFE ON A FARM
page.content: I live on quite a big farm called Farness. We live in the big farm manager's house because my dad is the farm manager. On the farm we have no cows but there are lots of sheep and there are a few different breeds. Suffolk, Cheviot, Mule and Suffolk cross. The Mule has a brown face with some white patches. As well as sheep we have quite a lot of fields with crops. We grow barley, oil-seed rape,turnip(for the sheep) and wheat. Dad has two men working for him and another man comes to help in the harvest and at lambing time. The shepherd is supposed to be retired but he is staying on to look after the Suffolks. I am very glad to live on a farm. I like to look after abandoned lambs. One Suffolk lamb had two broken legs, I called her Wendy. Mum and I share a donkey and a wee Shetland pony
